executive_summary: Multi-month credential attack campaign targeting Palo Alto GlobalProtect and SonicWall SonicOS with consistent client fingerprints across infrastructure changes. 9M+ HTTP sessions generated between September-December 2025 targeting VPN and API authentication endpoints.

phase_1.description: High-volume login and bruteforce attempts from clean ASNs

phase_2.description: Reduced activity with intermittent sessions around Thanksgiving

phase_4.description: SonicWall SonicOS API login attempts with same fingerprints

behavioral_indicators.indicator: Consistent client fingerprints across infrastructure changes
behavioral_indicators.description: Three identical client fingerprints observed across all campaign phases despite ASN rotation
behavioral_indicators.significance: Indicates tooling continuity and coordinated campaign

behavioral_indicators.description: 9M+ non-spoofable HTTP sessions targeting authentication surfaces
Same fingerprints used against both Palo Alto and SonicWall products

sigma_rules.title: High Volume Failed Authentication Attempts - GlobalProtect
sigma_rules.description: Detects high volume of failed authentication attempts against GlobalProtect portals

sigma_rules.title: GlobalProtect Authentication from Known Malicious ASN
sigma_rules.description: Detects authentication attempts from ASNs associated with December 2025 campaign

immediate_actions: Block traffic from identified ASNs (AS43350, AS215929, AS209588, AS211632, AS201011) at perimeter
Enable rate limiting on GlobalProtect and SonicWall authentication endpoints
Review authentication logs for suspicious velocity or repeated failures
Implement MFA if not already enabled on VPN and API endpoints
monitoring_recommendations: Track recurring client fingerprints to detect campaign continuity
Alert on authentication attempts from previously unseen ASNs with similar patterns
Implement dynamic blocking based on context-aware threat intelligence

mitre_attack_mapping.description: High-volume credential attempts against authentication portals
Attempting to gain valid credentials for unauthorized access
Targeting VPN infrastructure for initial access

threat_intelligence_context.infrastructure_rotation: Threat actor demonstrates capability to rotate infrastructure while maintaining tooling consistency
threat_intelligence_context.multi_vendor_targeting: Campaign targets multiple enterprise security vendors suggesting broad reconnaissance
threat_intelligence_context.session_volume: 9M+ non-spoofable sessions indicates significant resources and persistence
threat_intelligence_context.fingerprint_consistency: Identical client fingerprints across months of activity provides strong attribution signal

references.greynoise_report: A Hidden Pattern Within Months of Credential-Based Attacks Against Palo Alto GlobalProtect
references.report_author: Noah Stone, Head of Content, GreyNoise Intelligence
